title: Microlearning Modules on Basic Motorcycle Engine Repair Knowledge

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of mechanical operations and familiarity with basic engineering terminology
context.additional_context: Modular learning environment utilizing digital devices, providing real-time feedback through formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the functions of core motorcycle engine components (e.g., cylinder, piston, crankshaft).
Learners can diagnose and propose countermeasures for at least three common engine failure symptoms (e.g., excessive vibration, combustion irregularities).
Learners can simulate engine oil inspection and replacement procedures via a mobile module with over 80% accuracy.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
